Comments_List: I learned a lot about essay planning and building a research plan.

The course allowed us to workshop parts of our thesis and really talk through our ideas, which was very helpful. But I wish there was more learning in the course, learning about methodologies of research, organizing a thesis, etc at the very beginning of the course.
The course does not have an imposed workload. This can be really good sometimes but oftentimes makes it easy to keep the necessary work on the back burner.

It was useful to be in dialogue with other seniors in the major digging into their own projects through the semester. I think more guidance on what each of us ought to be doing individually to keep our projects moving forward even beyond the workshops would be usefuli.e., what we should have accomplished at a given point, or guidance on how we can set those goals for ourselves.

This course is required for political science majors who wish to write a year-long thesis. It is helpful to workshop your ideas with a group of students. However, everyone comes to the class at very different stages of their thesis, and it can be difficult to figure out where exactly you should be in the process.
If you are prepared to dedicate yourself to your thesis, then definitely do it!
